arts.ttl: 'Don't feel sorry for anybody' - Van Nistelrooy accepts Foxes criticism
arts.sum: Leicester City manager Ruud van Nistelrooy accepts criticism aimed at him from the home crowd after the loss to Fulham, but how bad have things got for the Dutchman?

arts.ttl: Ruud van Nistelrooy reacts to boos for Bilal El Khannouss sub as Leicester City manager heckled
arts.sum: Speaking after the game, van Nistelrooy turned down the opportunity to specifically explain the El Khannouss substitution, saying it’s not something he has to make public. Ruud van Nistelrooy refused to explain exactly why he substituted Bilal El Khannouss in a change that prompted a backlash from the stands at the King Power Stadium.

arts.ttl: Ruud van Nistelrooy accepts criticism after Leicester slip to another defeat
arts.sum: Fulham won at the King Power Stadium.

arts.ttl: Fulham remain in European hunt as Leicester's woes continue
arts.sum: Following a midweek loss at West Ham United, which ended an eight-game unbeaten run in the Premier League, the visitors stayed composed as second-half goals from Emile Smith Rowe and Adama Traore secured their victory. The hosts had the better of the first half but failed to capitalise on this and were punished just three minutes after the break, when Smith Rowe headed Fulham at home.

arts.ttl: Leicester fans turn on Ruud van Nistelrooy after just 10 games with brutal chant
arts.sum: LEICESTER 0-2 FULHAM: Ruud van Nistelrooy was appointed at the King Power in November less three weeks after leaving Manchester United and his reign has already turned sour

arts.ttl: Leicester 0-2 Fulham: Highlights, man of the match, stats as Harry Wilson stars for the Cottagers
arts.sum: Fulham comfortably brush aside Leicester City in 2-0 victory on Saturday afternoon, condemning the Foxes to a miserable seventh consecutive Premier League defeat.

arts.ttl: Fulham extend Leicester’s losing Premier League run to seven games
arts.sum: The hosts went down to two second half goals.

arts.ttl: Smith Rowe and Traore score in Fulham victory
arts.sum: Fulham returned to winning ways with goals from Emile Smith Rowe and Adama Traore. After Sasa Lukic headed on Harry Wilson’s cross, Smith Rowe showed great bravery to put himself in harm’s way by stooping to head home from close range. Lukic and Wilson were also involved in the build-up to the second goal – […] The post Smith Rowe and Traore score in Fulham victory appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: Alexander Isak's scoring run in Premier League ends at 8 games. Jamie Vardy's record safe for now
arts.sum: The Sweden international had scored in eight straight games before failing to find the net in Newcastle’s 4-1 loss to Bournemouth on Saturday. Ruud van Nistelrooy (Manchester United), March-August 2003

arts.ttl: Leicester City transfer state of play as potential exits open door for new signings
arts.sum: Van Nistelrooy has spoken of needing to cover for injuries in the squad, and has said Coulibaly helps in that regard, with Ricardo Pereira out for at least another couple of months. Leicester City need to create space in their squad and build up a pot of cash to help bring in further January signings.
